weekly_top_story.headline: Hospitals Brace for Rise in High-Risk Pregnancies Amid Closure of Labor Units
weekly_top_story.summary: Hospitals and health systems are preparing for an increase in high-risk pregnancies while many labor and delivery units are shutting down, posing challenges for maternal care capacity.

stories.headline: Bariatric Surgery Linked to Improved Outcomes in Obese IBD Patients
stories.summary: New research indicates bariatric surgery may improve disease outcomes in patients with obesity who suffer from inflammatory bowel disease, offering a potential therapeutic benefit.

stories.headline: New Coverage Guidelines Released for Home Noninvasive Ventilation in COPD Treatment
stories.summary: The American College of Chest Physicians issued updated coverage guidelines for the use of noninvasive ventilation at home in COPD patients, potentially impacting treatment accessibility.

stories.headline: Paraguayan and U.S. Surgeons Collaborate to Restore Sight and Rebuild Face
stories.summary: Medical professionals from the U.S. and Paraguay jointly performed a complex reconstructive surgery restoring both vision and facial structure, showcasing international healthcare cooperation.
